content:
This is your first Nussknacer instance. You can play with it to see what you can do with Nu Cloud.

Click the link to open Nussknacker Designer.

This is a list of your scenarios. We created an example scenario for you.

Open it to see what it does, how you can send some data to Nussknacker and how Nussknacker reacts.

The first node of every scenario defines the source of data the scenario is processing.

Double-click it to see what is the source of data in our example.

*http.example-input* is the input topic of this scenario. Communication with topics in Nu Cloud (sending and receiving events) is over HTTP. To send an input event, you can for example: -
execute this curl command (click to expand) curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -u publisher: %%password%% https://%%tenant%%-gateway.staging-cloud.nussknacker.io/topics/http.example-input -d '{ "name": "Nutcracker" }'
- use your browser to send an HTTP request by clicking here After you have sent the event go to the Next step
If Nussknacker received your event, it has already been processed by now. To see what happened, head over to the Topics list.
Open the input topic first, the one you have just sent an event to.

Here you can find the last events in the topic. Since this topic is used as an input for the example scenario, all the events you see here are processed by this scenario.
If you don’t see any events, click here to see how to resend them - execute this curl command: curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -u publisher: %%password%% https://%%tenant%%-gateway.staging-cloud.nussknacker.io/topics/http.example-input -d '{ "name": "Nutcracker" }' - use your browser to send an HTTP request by clicking here
Now let’s see the result Nussknacker produced. [Back to topics list](https://%%tenant%%-nussknacker.staging-cloud.nussknacker.io/topics/)

*example-output* topic is set to be the output of the example scenario in the last node of the scenario, which is called a sink.

Open the output topic, to see the result of processing of the event you’ve sent.

To receive results (output events) Nussknacker produces, you use Nu Cloud topic subscriptions. Nussknacker will send all the events in a chosen topic to an HTTP endpoint you provide.

If you have an endpoint Nussknacker can send HTTP POST requests to, click *Add subscription* to try it out.

If you don’t want to add a subscription now [Skip this step].

Subscription name and description can be anything you want. Endpoint is the URL of the endpoint you want to receive the events from the topic.
After you add the subscription, try sending some more events to the example scenario, to get the output events on your endpoint (click to see how). - execute this curl command: curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -u publisher: %%password%% https://%%tenant%%-gateway.staging-cloud.nussknacker.io/topics/http.example-input -d '{ "name": "Nutcracker" }' - use your browser to send an HTTP request by clicking here

If you want to know more about Nussknacker, you can start with the [Overview](https://nussknacker.io/documentation/about/Overview/).

To learn more about creating your own scenarios, see [Scenarios authoring](https://nussknacker.io/documentation/docs/scenarios_authoring/).

If you have your own Kafka cluster, check out Connecting to [Confluent Cloud](https://nussknacker.io/documentation/cloud/confluent/), [Aiven](https://nussknacker.io/documentation/cloud/aiven/), [Azure Event Hubs](https://nussknacker.io/documentation/cloud/azure/), [Redpanda](https://nussknacker.io/documentation/cloud/redpanda/) or [a generic Kafka cluster](https://nussknacker.io/documentation/cloud/configuration/#configuring-access-to-existing-kafka-cluster).

<Next>Close</Next>
